intro: Stephania hypoglauca, commonly known as the blue-green stephania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Menispermaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by elliptical, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
